newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-HOLDERS AUXERRE UPSET BY SECOND DIVISION TROYES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HOLDERS AUXERRE UPSET BY SECOND DIVISION TROYES.

text.p: Holders Auxerre crashed out of the French Cup 1-0 at second division Troyes on Friday, five days before their European Cup quarter-final first leg away to Borussia Dortmund.
Striker David Merdy headed the winner in injury time against the side who won the French Cup and league championship double last season.

Already out of the League Cup and 13 points adrift of leaders Monaco in the first division, Auxerre's only realistic hope of a trophy this season remains the European Cup, having surprisingly finished top of their Champions' League group.
Coach Guy Roux was critical of his players, saying: "Some big names had a small game. The attitude of the club in the French Cup deserved an upset like that.
"Sure we're going through a bad phase, but it didn't start today," he added.
With forwards Bernard Diomede and Lilian Laslandes and midfielder Christian Henna missing good chances, Auxerre have not scored in their last four matches.
"The European Cup? That's another problem," Roux said.
Auxerre play the first leg in Dortmund on Wednesday and host the return two weeks later.
